abstract.p: Prince Naseem Hamed wins 12-round decision over Manuel Calvo to capture IBO featherweigth title (S)

block.p: Prince Naseem Hamed won the International Boxing Organization's featherweight title by defeating Manuel Calvo on points in London yesterday.

Hamed, the World Boxing Organization featherweight champion from 1995-2000, was returning to the ring for the first time for 13 months but was jeered after an unimpressive performance in front of 10,000 fans at the London Arena. (Agence France-Presse)

TSZYU WINS 12-ROUND DECISION TO RETAIN TITLES: The last time Kostya Tszyu fought he won with a spectacular knockout. Against Ben Tackie last night, he showed he can win impressively going the distance, too.

TSZYU WINS 12-ROUND DECISION TO RETAIN TITLES: The last time Kostya Tszyu fought he won with a spectacular knockout. Against Ben Tackie last night, he showed he can win impressively going the distance, too.
Fighting for the first time since stopping Zab Judah to win the undisputed 140-pound title, Tszyu put on a boxing exhibition on his way to a 12-round decision over Tackie to retain his three titles.

In a fight that grew repetitive as the rounds went on, Tszyu was simply too good of a boxer for the game challenger to overcome. At times, Tszyu looked more like he was in a relaxed sparring session against Tackie, the I.B.F.'s top-ranked challenger, than in a real fight.
Tszyu (29-1-1) took few chances, content to jab and box and pile up round after round on the scorecards of the ringside judges.
Tszyu won every round on two of the scorecards, 120-108, and was ahead by 119-109 on the third. The Associated Press had Tszyu, a Russian native who lives in Australia, winning, 119-109. (AP)
